newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: S.Africa JSE posts record turnover again - dealers.
newsitem.headline: S.Africa JSE posts record turnover again - dealers.

text.p: The Johannesburg Stock Exchange (JSE) saw its second consecutive record day of turnover with more than 2.1 billion rands worth of shares changing hands, dealers said.
A JSE spokesman confirmed that it was the biggest turnover ever, but said the bourse was still verifying the exact amount and would release a statement shortly.
"It is the highest for a day," the spokesman said.
Dealers pegged the figure at around 2.17 billion rand, beating a record set on Friday of 1.506 billion rand. The JSE was closed on Monday for the Freedom Day holiday.
Traders said a massive deal in over 18 million NBS Holdings Ltd shares, worth a total of around 1.359 billion rand, was largely responsible for the fresh high.
"It must be the single biggest deal ever," one dealer said.

The deal was related to the sale in March by RMB Holdings of a 22.2 percent in NBS to financial services group Board of Executors Ltd (BOE). BOE paid 1.37 billion rand or 68.35 cents a share for the stake.
In a separate transaction also announced in March, BOE said it would team up with the newly merged NBS and Boland Bank Holdings Ltd to create South Africa's fifth largst banking group.
